I wonder if there is a way to build something like the Power Data Grapple Fixture for Canadarm2 on the ISS?

http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/8d/Power_Data_Grapple_Fixture_on_station.jpg/400px-Power_Data_Grapple_Fixture_on_station.jpg

The way it works is like this: The Canadarm2 has its grapple mechanism on either end. Using that, it can attach to any PDGF anywhere on the station, using either end of the arm. It can then attach to another PDGF with the other end, and release the first end. That way, it can move about the station as desired.

So far I've used the magnetic hook from KAS to hold onto things (only on one end, with the other end being fixed in place), but I'd really like to use something like the PDGF mechanism. Is it possible?

We have built one already, or something similar. It's coming in the MSI animator pack. Would not be hard to add a decoupler type version. I'll whack one together today I need a break from other stuff.
